poem:
Title: "In Time's Delay"

Courthouse spectre, Trump's bellow echoes,
Trials raised, then cast in shadow.
A legal dance, cicada slow, enveloping truth's glow. 
In quiet tilt, old Justice wears her blindfold,
Unheedful of the hurry of man's world.
Till votes are cast, decisions withheld,
Slow Wheels grind for wealth untold,
Mocking us in the silence, silent as the cold.
